intro: Andrea, commonly known as the Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the genus Alstroemeria, which includes several species known for their vibrant, showy blooms. The plant typically features long, narrow leaves and clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Andrea thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical name, Alstroemeria, honors the Swedish botanist and physician Johan Alströmer.
